standard_metadata.standard_description: Know relative sizes of measurement units within one system of units including km, m, cm; kg, g; lb, oz.; l, ml; hr, min, sec. Within a single system of measurement, express measurements in a larger unit in terms of a smaller unit. Record measurement equivalents in a two-column table.
standard_metadata.standard_title: Convert to smaller units (mm, cm, m, & km)

hints.content: We need to convert $\blueD{8}$ meters $\maroonD{21}$ centimeters to centimeters.
First, let's convert $\blueD{8}$ meters to centimeters.  $1 \text{ meter} = \greenD{100}\text{ centimeters}$   $\blueD{8} \text{ meters} = \blueD{8}\times \greenD{100}=\blueD{800}\text{ centimeters}$
Now, we need to add $\maroonD{21}$ centimeters.  $\blueD{800}\text{ cm}+\maroonD{21}\text{ cm}=\blueD8\maroonD{21}\text{ cm}$
We need to convert $\blueD{11}$ kilometers $\maroonD{375}$ meters to meters.

First, let's convert $\blueD{11}$ kilometers to meters.  $1 \text{ kilometer} = \greenD{1{,}000}\text{ meters}$   $\blueD{11} \text{ kilometers} = \blueD{11}\times \greenD{1{,}000}=\blueD{11{,}000}\text{ meters}$
Now, we need to add $\maroonD{375}$ meters.  $\blueD{11{,}000}\text{ m}+\maroonD{375}\text{ m}=\blueD{11}{,}\maroonD{375}\text{ m}$
We need to convert $\blueD{4}$ meters $\maroonD{85}$ millimeters to millimeters.

First, let's convert $\blueD{4}$ meters to millimeters.  $1 \text{ meter} = \greenD{1{,}000}\text{ millimeters}$   $\blueD{4} \text{ meters} = \blueD{4}\times \greenD{1{,}000}=\blueD{4{,}000}\text{ millimeters}$
Now, we need to add $\maroonD{85}$ millimeters.  $\blueD{4{,}000}\text{ mm}+\maroonD{85}\text{ mm}=\blueD{4}{,}\blueD0\maroonD{85}\text{ mm}$
We need to convert $\blueD{15}$ centimeters $\maroonD{4}$ millimeters to millimeters.

First, let's convert $\blueD{15}$ centimeters to millimeters.  $1 \text{ centimeter} = \greenD{10}\text{ millimeters}$   $\blueD{15} \text{ centimeters} = \blueD{15}\times \greenD{10}=\blueD{150}\text{ millimeters}$
Now, we need to add $\maroonD{4}$ millimeters.  $\blueD{150}\text{ mm}+\maroonD{4}\text{ mm}=\blueD{15}\maroonD{4}\text{ mm}$

question.content: **Complete the table to show equivalent measurements in kilometers and meters.**  Kilometers| Meters  :-: | :-:  $1$ |   $5$ |  $9$|
**Complete the table to show equivalent measurements in kilometers and meters.**  Kilometers| Meters  :-: | :-:  $2$ |   $6$ |  $10$|

hints.content: $\begin{align} \blueD2 \text{ kilometers} &= \blueD{2}\times \greenD{1{,}000} = \blueD2{,}\greenD{000}\text{ meters}\\\\ \blueD6 \text{ kilometers} &= \blueD{6}\times \greenD{1{,}000} = \blueD6{,}\greenD{000}\text{ meters}\\\\ \blueD{10} \text{ kilometers} &= \blueD{10}\times \greenD{1{,}000} = \blueD{10}{,}\greenD{000}\text{ meters} \end{align}$

question.content: **Complete the table to show equivalent measurements in meters and centimeters.**  Meters| Centimeters  :-: | :-:  $1$ |   $2$ |  $8$|
**Complete the table to show equivalent measurements in meters and centimeters.**  Meters| Centimeters  :-: | :-:  $4$ |   $5$ |  $9$|

hints.content: $\begin{align} \blueD{4} \text{ meters} &= \blueD{4}\times \greenD{100}=\blueD{4}\greenD{00}\text{ centimeters}\\\\ \blueD{5} \text{ meters} &= \blueD{5}\times \greenD{100}=\blueD{5}\greenD{00}\text{ centimeters}\\\\ \blueD{9} \text{ meters} &= \blueD{9}\times \greenD{100}=\blueD{9}\greenD{00}\text{ centimeters} \end{align}$

question.content: **Complete the table to show equivalent measurements in meters and millimeters.**  Meters| Millimeters  :-: | :-:  $1$ |   $3$ |  $8$|
**Complete the table to show equivalent measurements in centimeters and millimeters.**  Centimeters| Millimeters  :-: | :-:  $3$ |   $6$ |  $10$|

hints.content: $\begin{align} \blueD{3} \text{ centimeters} &= \blueD{3}\times \greenD{10}=\blueD{3}\greenD{0}\text{ millimeters}\\\\ \blueD{6} \text{ centimeters} &= \blueD{6}\times \greenD{10}=\blueD{6}\greenD{0}\text{ millimeters}\\\\ \blueD{10} \text{ centimeters} &= \blueD{10}\times \greenD{10}=\blueD{10}\greenD{0}\text{ millimeters} \end{align}$
To compare, we need the numbers to have the same units.    Let's convert $\blueD5$ centimeters to millimeters.
Now, we can compare.  $65\text{ millimeters} > \blueD{50}\text{ millimeters}$
To compare, we need the numbers to have the same units.    Let's convert $\blueD2$ meters to centimeters.
Now, we can compare.  ${200}\text{ centimeters} = \blueD{200}\text{ centimeters}$
To compare, we need the numbers to have the same units.    Let's convert $\blueD3$ kilometers to meters.
Now, we can compare.  $\blueD{3{,}000}\text{ meters}> {300} \text{ meters}$
To compare, we need the numbers to have the same units.    Let's convert $\blueD8$ centimeters to millimeters.
Now, we can compare.  $\blueD{80}\text{ millimeters} >{19}\text{ millimeters}$
To compare, we need the numbers to have the same units.    Let's convert $\blueD4$ meters to millimeters.
Now, we can compare.  $\blueD{4{,}000}\text{ millimeters} ={4{,}000}\text{ millimeters}$
To compare, we need the numbers to have the same units.    Let's convert $\blueD5$ kilometers to meters.
Now, we can compare.  ${700}\text{ meters} <\blueD{5{,}000}\text{ meters}$
To compare, we need the numbers to have the same units.    Let's convert $\blueD6$ meters to millimeters.
Now, we can compare.  ${975}\text{ millimeters} <\blueD{6{,}000}\text{ millimeters}$
